description: The Network Canvas development protocol is designed for our team to test new features. It is not intended for general use.

options.label: Value One is also long, with break
Value A has additional text to go along with it
Value C is a label that has too much text - shorten it
Value One is also long, _with break_
Value A **has additional** text to go along with it
Value C is a label that has too much text - **shorten it**

stages.interviewScript:
This is a **markdown field** that contains notes for the interviewer that are printed with the codebook, and can be reviewed during the interview.

For now it will only support rich text, but not images or audio.
stages.label: Ego Form

fields.prompt: How much do you like likert scales?
Which of these things do you like?
Which of these other things do you like?
Is the switch below not turned on?
What is your date of birth?
Pick your *favourite* day in the last 60 days

introductionPanel.title: Introduction to the ego form
introductionPanel.text: There are multiple ways to describe **you**.

stages.interviewScript: This is an example of interview script on a name generator.
stages.label: NG with external data

prompts.text: Who would _you_ consider to be a **close friend**?
This is a particularly long prompt, which will be discouraged in the Architect interface but might still be desired by a researcher. What does this look like rendered?
Prompt with no additional attributes
Second prompt with no additional attributes
NameGen with CSV external data
This name generator creates venue nodes using the quick add form
Another venue prompt

introductionPanel.title: Introduction to the Dyad Census
introductionPanel.text: This section will go through all possible node pairs and ask you how they are connected.

prompts.text: Are these people friends?
Do these people work together?

introductionPanel.title: Introduction to the Tie-Strength Census
introductionPanel.text: This interface both creates an edge and assigns an ordinal value to it.

prompts.text: Thinking about each pair of people, please choose the option that best describes **how close they are to one another**.
How often do these people work together on important projects?
Contact frequency ordinal variable for close ties only
Discussion Frequency variable, with a much longer prompt than the previous prompt. Please also note that this prompt uses the color override to style these bins differently than the main prompt.
Showing an ordinalbin interface with a node type other than person.
HIV Venue CSV data, with no sort options or additional attributes.
previous interview JSON

fields.prompt: How much do you like **likert scales**?
Which of *these things* do you like?
Which of these **other** things do you like?
Is the switch below not turned _on_?
This is a variable whose **value** you must choose!

prompts.text: This name generator is designed to test input types
This interface uses the concentric circles background and excludes John and William
Creates a second edge type
Toggle variable
This prompt shows 3 concentric circles and has create edge and allow highlight specified (against the rules!)
This interface uses a background image
Which classmates would you also think of as friends?
Which of these classmates would help you with homework?
Which of these venues have you visited in the previous 6 months?
Categorical bin excluding nodes called "William"
Three with other
prompts.otherVariablePrompt: What were you thinking of instead?

prompts.text: Four
What is the most frequent type of contact you have?
Discussion type variable, with a much longer prompt than the previous prompt. Please also note that this prompt uses the max number of bins.

fields.prompt: What is this person's life story?
Does this person have this boolean attribute?
Which of these does this person like?
Do you want to do another likert?

introductionPanel.title: Introduction to the alter form
introductionPanel.text:
This is some **markdown** that 
* explains this interface and 
* is *marked down*. 

Below this might be as much additional text as the researcher desires. The container that this content is in should dynamically expand to accommodate that.

introductionPanel.title: Introduction to the alter edge form
introductionPanel.text: This per alter edge form shows friend edges, but filters any edges where either node also also has a professional edge.

introductionPanel.title: An alternative alter edge interface
introductionPanel.text: This interface acts on professional edges.

presets.label: Another preset (with more text than will fit)

stages.label: InfoSound
stages.title: This interface has a video with sound.

items.content: The video below has sound and is set to loop. Some arbitrary text content that can _contain_ **formatting**.

# h1 Heading 8-)
## h2 Heading
### h3 Heading
#### h4 Heading
##### h5 Heading
###### h6 Heading

## Emphasis

**This is bold text**

__This is bold text__

*This is italic text* 

_This is italic text_ 
# Emoji 
:blush: :heartpulse: :wave:

stages.label: Skip or Show
stages.title: To skip or not to skip...
